p: While detection of the H275Y substitution was based on residue-specific pyrosequencing methods in the majority of specimens, Sanger sequencing was used in a proportion of samples, which allowed detection of 2 other resistance-conferring substitutions, that is, R293K and N295S (N1 numbering) [ 18]. Neither of these substitutions was found in 29 specimens from 14 patients after initiation of treatment ( Supplementary Table 2) and in specimens from 14 patients with no treatment.
